reviewText: If you are intelligent, love great humor and can appreciate subtle jokes, Evil Roy Slade is the funniest SPOOF of American westerns you will ever watch.  "It's been weeks since I shot a woman," is just one of many sly winks at western heroes that will leave you laughing from the first minute to the last minute.  Great script.  Superb performances.  Until recently, it cost $175 to buy a copy so as soon as I saw it for less than $10 I jumped on it.  Will send it to other friends in upcoming months.  If you love John Astin, you will love ERS.  Haven't ever see the Brothers O'Toole and am looking forward to it.  If you don't get anything else out of this review, IT IS HILARIOUS.  Buy it.  You won't be sorry

reviewText: I purchased this DVD because I really enjoyed the Villain and Amazon sent me a recommendation for this one. I'm glad I purchased it as Evil Roy Slade was as good as the Villain. Brother's O'Toole was good too but not quite as good as the other two. I would definitely recommend all 3 movies especially the Villain and Evil Roy Slade if you like Comedy Westerns. Arnold Swartzenegger is great in the Villain and John Astin plays a great evil criminal.Evil Roy Slade[[ASIN:B000063INF The Villain]]
Title: N/A

reviewText: Evil Roy Slade had the feeling of a 1970s farce, although never quite reaching the level of Young Frankenstein. With its renditions of "Stubby Index Finger," lawman Bing Bell (was that the door?) and various deadpan lines the movie was fun. John Astin was great in this, playing a character much like Gomez Addams... except not as nice of course. The Brothers O'Toole was not quite as good, not quite as many laughs but still not a bad film. Brothers O'Toole had more of a feeling of "television pilot" written all over it.
summary: "Never trust a pretty woman or a lonely midget"
Title: N/A

reviewText: I thought these movies were hilarious when I was young and still enjoy them now, though not as much.  They star John Astin (who played Gomez Addams on the TV show Addams Family and whose son played Sam in the Lord of the Rings trilogy).  I like John Astin but only give these 4 stars for those who might not like his style or the type of comedy used.  I consider them good late night movies.

reviewText: Another instance where memory and nostalgia got the better of me.  I watched these when I was a kid.  It was very funny then.  Not so much now.  I also mixed it up with the movie The Villian.  Both bad guys are named Slade - Evil Roy and Cactus Jack.  The Villian is better.
summary: Evil Roy Slade, memory made it better than it is.
